definition: to reverse cause and effect/to put the horse before the cart
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
